actions.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

official_title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate in honoring the service of the men and women who served in the Armed Forces of the United States during World War II.

summary.text: Expresses the Senate's eternal appreciation for veterans of the U.S. Armed Forces who fought to protect the United States and to preserve freedom and the U.S. way of life during World War II. Honors the men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice and gave their lives during that global conflict. Commends the 108 former members and six current members of the Senate who are veterans of World War II, including Senator Akaka, Senator Hollings, Senator Inouye, Senator Lautenberg, Senator Stevens, and Senator Warner.

titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate in honoring the service of the men and women who served in the Armed Forces of the United States during World War II.
